meanings.definition: Apply fresh lubricant to (something) to make it work smoothly.
meanings.sent1: I need to relubricate the squeaky door hinges to stop the noise.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will relubricate the gears in the engine to ensure they move freely.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally used glue instead of oil to relubricate the bike chain!
meanings.sent4: She relubricated the conversation with humor, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent5: The old machine groaned until I relubricated its rusty parts.

meanings.definition: To add lubricant again to (something) to keep it running smoothly.
meanings.sent1: Don't forget to relubricate the bike chain after riding in the rain.
meanings.sent2: It is important to regularly relubricate the bearings in the machine to prevent wear.
meanings.sent3: I had to relubricate the wheels of my suitcase after they got stuck in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The team captain relubricated the game plan to ensure victory.
meanings.sent5: The gardener relubricated the lawnmower before starting the yard work.
